arts.ttl: Monza Rehire Nesta in Desperate Bid to Avoid Relegation
arts.sum: Monza have decided to make a dramatic change on the bench following their crushing 5-1 defeat against Lazio at the Stadio Olimpico. Salvatore Bocchetti is reportedly on the verge of being dismissed, with Alessandro Nesta set to return as head coach of the struggling Serie A side. The post Monza Rehire Nesta in Desperate Bid to Avoid Relegation appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Lazio’s Baroni: “We Shouldn’t Look at Others. I Focus Only on My League”
arts.sum: Lazio secured a convincing 5-1 victory against Monza at the Stadio Olimpico, with Marco Baroni's team delivering an impressive performance. The win came courtesy of goals from Adam Marusic, Valentin Castellanos, Dele-Bashiru, and a brace from Pedro, while Stefano Sensi scored the consolation goal for the visitors. The post Lazio’s Baroni: “We Shouldn’t Look at Others. I Focus Only on My League” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Taty Castellanos Enchants as Sensational Lazio Smash Five Past Hopeless Monza
arts.sum: After a run of four winless matches at home, Lazio roared back by demolishing Monza by five goals to one at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Lazio Starting Lineup Marco Baroni confirmed his attacking choices as Taty Castellanos spearheaded the 4-2-3-1 formation, supported by Gustav Isasksen, Boulaye Dia and Mattia Zaccagni. arts.ttl: Serie A | Lazio 5-1 Monza: Match Report
arts.sum: Lazio delivered a resounding performance at the Stadio Olimpico, dismantling a struggling Monza side 5-1 in a match that saw Pedro bag a brace, alongside goals from Adam Marusic, Fisayo Dele-Bashiru, and Taty Castellanos, who celebrated his first Serie A home goal since September. arts.ttl: Jose Mourinho Set Sights on Lazio Veteran With Expiring Contract
arts.sum: Fenerbahce are reportedly interested in Lazio midfielder Matias Vecino as they look to bolster Jose Mourinho’s squad. The Background The 33-year-old has been plying his trade in Italian football since joining Fiorentina in 2013. After representing Cagliari, Empoli and Inter Milan, the midfielder signed for Lazio on a free transfer in the summer of 2022. arts.ttl: Lazio’s Gila Postpones Contract Renewal: Reasons and Scenarios
arts.sum: Mario Gila has become a Galactico at Lazio, finding his Real Madrid-level dimension in Rome. The explosion of this bright star has been nothing short of remarkable. Corriere dello Sport detail how Gila is one of the few defenders capable of shifting the axis of matches, as demonstrated recently in Cagliari.
